items.title: Contentious July jobs report confirms the U.S. economy is slowing sharply. Hereâ€™s why
items.description: The weakness in job growth points to an economy that may be slowing even more than some of the traditional metrics are showing.

items.title: Trump set to name replacements at the Fed and Bureau of Labor Statistics in coming days
items.description: Both spots opened up Friday through the resignation of Fed Governor Adriana Kugler and the firing of Erika McEntarfer at the BLS.

items.title: Housing to remain weakest part of economy, falling 8% in the second half, Goldman says
items.description: The Wall Street investment bank named immigration and affordability challenges as two obstacles standing in the way a housing boost.

items.title: Switzerland's tariff shock: The 39% U.S. hit no one saw coming
items.description: The duty would be a "devastating" blow to the export-reliant Swiss economy and businesses, analysts say.

items.title: Fed Governor Kugler is resigning, giving Trump a nominee on committee that sets interest rates
items.description: Her resignation now paves the way for Trump to put his own nominee in for the Board of Governors.
